publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules-That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-543 Right to Buy Rules (lodged on 14 February 2000) Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-543 Right to Buy Rules (lodged on 14 February 2000) Mr Keith Harding*, Ben Wallace*, Nick Johnston*, David Mundell*

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell
S1M-543 Right to Buy Rules (lodged on 14 February 2000) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mr David Davidson*, Mary Scanlon*
S1M-543 Right to Buy Rules (lodged on 14 February 2000) Phil Gallie*

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie
S1M-543 Right to Buy Rules (lodged on 14 February 2000) David McLetchie*

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie, David McLetchie

S1M-543 Bill Aitken: Right to Buy Rules—That the Parliament, recognising the disappointment and frustration caused to council tenants by the precipitate haste in amending the terms of the Right to Buy rules in March 1999, calls upon the Scottish Executive to review the situation in order that those who can demonstrate the intention to purchase their homes prior to the change in the legislation on 1 April 1999 can avail themselves of the rights which existed prior to this change. Supported by: Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Keith Harding, Ben Wallace, Nick Johnston, David Mundell, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie, David McLetchie
